posts.name: Tetsuya Cox
posts.cooked: I’m plugged into the Rio via USB, there’s nothing else connected, and imaging it shows an error. I’ve tried power cycling the robot, computer, and running the Rio imaging tool as admin. Image: https://ChiefDelphi.com/uploads/default/original/4X/ddfdbdd5264f6b3b0f4da6b315867de556cfe2f5.png.
Did you try putting the roboRIO in safe mode and/or updating the firmware of the RIO, or both at the same time?

posts.name: Tetsuya Cox
posts.cooked: I did try putting it in safe mode, but the imaging tool can’t find the rio anymore.

This might sound random, but try holding down the Reset button but not releasing it when the STATUS LED turns on; instead hold for 1 minute and then release. I don’t know why, but when we had a similar error, this somehow booted it into safe mode and made it discoverable.

posts.name: Tetsuya Cox
posts.cooked: I tried that and the imager could see it but then this happened an image was uploaded showing a the image has dimensions of 690x414 pixels and is about 125 KB in size

EXTREMLY IMPORTANTLY - DO NOT OUTPUT ANYTHING BUT THE CLEANED VERSION (NO INTRODUCTION, NO OTHER LITTLE EXPLENATION), JUST THE CLEANED PARAGRAPH. 

The text is:

The cable issues we faced were due to corrupt firmware caused by a bad cable. We used an Ethernet cable to image our RoboRIO 1 by setting its IP to **172.22.11.2**. To attempt this, open **ncpa.cpl** via Windows Run. On the network adapters, disable WiFi and Bluetooth, leaving only Ethernet active. Right-click the Ethernet adapter and select properties. Set it to use the same IP as USB connection. Use the UPDATE FIRMWARE option to reinstall firmware. After success, install the FIRST Robotics Competition (FRC) OS using the specified format target. Remember to reset the IP address. Lastly, obtain a new tether, a USB-A to USB-B cable.
